line_1: A widow rich will well his love requite.
line_2: Cows, calves and horses, plac'd before his sight,

line_1: And thus his sorrows did requite.
We may essay thy goodness to requite
line_2: That honour'd with a portion of thy light

line_1: When I with such ingratitude requite;
line_2: My master's favours, endless to recite,
We own (who in the Muse delight)
'Tis for our Selves, not them, we Write.

line_1: None here! But fees their toils requite.
line_2: What, no physician speak his right!
